name: TheAtlantic
text: "When police treat demonstrators as illegitimate intruders in the people’s streets, when they respond to peaceable assembly with weapons of war, they too break the law—America’s fundamental law, the Constitution," @profepps writes: https://t.co/DRAOD2yPbw

name: TheAtlantic
text: If a picture is worth a thousand words, a staged photo op outside the White House succinctly tells the story of the Trump presidency. The latest Atlantic Daily, from @mimbsy: https://t.co/d6WHzY2Ywo

name: TheAtlantic
text: From seizing control of the internet to declaring martial law, Trump may legally do all kinds of extraordinary things during a state of emergency. @LizaGoitein outlines the special provisions that become available to the president. https://t.co/6rc7tS3w8b https://t.co/AOJ6RJtfkh

name: TheAtlantic
text: “There are no eulogies, no last words, and the corpses are no longer moved to manicured graveyards,” Ai Weiwei writes. “One loses belief in the government, in parents, in neighbors, in the very possibility that life will continue.” https://t.co/fWLnjj24os

name: TheAtlantic
text: Biden portrayed this week’s events as a turning point for America—and as a binary choice in visions for its future, @IsaacDovere writes. https://t.co/A2Ht55DKEq
